intro: Lippia strigulosa f. parvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lippia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Verbenaceae family. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of tiny, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in areas with warm, humid climates. It typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, often found in open woodlands and disturbed soils. Its aromatic foliage and ornamental flowers make it a valuable plant for both horticultural and ecological purposes.
